title: witti error: Block has an unknown parent: 0xa243…8e13, id: 4, service: sync
body:
## Description

Lighthouse fails to sync Witti.

## Version

`master` @ 9db0c280510bb0d8ceaafe61f1e2f9ff39707ca5

## Present Behaviour

https://termbin.com/5zr6

```
Jun 16 14:07:05.220 WARN Batch processing failed                 error: Block has an unknown parent: 0xa243…8e13, id: 4, service: sync
Jun 16 14:07:05.448 WARN Batch processing failed                 error: Block has an unknown parent: 0xa243…8e13, id: 4, service: sync

Jun 16 14:08:30.000 INFO Syncing                                 est_time: --, speed: 0.00 slots/sec, distance: 135548 slots (2 weeks 4 days), peers: 12, service: slot_notifier

```

## Expected Behaviour

Sync Witti

## Steps to resolve

N/A

I had similar issue today, also see the `Disconnecting and banning peer` and `ERROR yamux::connection`. In addition with `CRIT Beacon block processing error           error: ValidatorPubkeyCacheLockTimeout, service: beacon`

Beacon node got stopped. Restarted beacon node it sync passed those blocks then back to normal. My guess would be some bad data when syncing with slot 147807. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/148800/84778028-b8dd2280-b025-11ea-8850-583a5af80040.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/148800/84778045-c09cc700-b025-11ea-8bfc-3311b330085a.png)

> @leckylao thanks for the report! I have two questions, if you will?
> 
> * What CPU is this running on. Rough description is fine, e.g. a Raspberry Pi or a 16 core beast.

It runs on single core cpu. 

> * How many times did you see this error message? I'm interested in knowing if this happened a few times intermittently or if it happened without fail for several minutes.

First time so far. After restart now has been running fine for a day. Will keep an eye on it.
We've isolated the sync bug and should have that sorted. Thanks for the report @q9f

Copy that, thanks @leckylao. Given it's running on a single core and we have the discv5 CPU usage issue (fixed by #1274) I'm confident to put this down to resource contention causing the lock to be held for more than the timeout, instead of a logic bug that we need to deal with explicitly.

iam at this point with the lighthouse 0.2.9... purge-db? 

// worked, no issues so far
